import './Faq.css'; function Faq(){ return(

Frequently Asked Questions

Click on the questions below

If your question is not found, please message us through our Contact Page

Covid19 Policies & Protocols

Vaccinations are encouraged for students, faculty, and staff. The more that get vaccinated, the more we will be able to provide the ideal campus experience.

Students should submit a notarized copy of their vaccination card or certificates to the Registrar's Office within the first week of classes.

The University strongly encourages students to wear their masks at all times during gathering of five or more.

Students who come into close contact with infected persons will be required to take a covid test. Even if the test is negative, students will be required to quarantine for two weeks in their residence. This quarantine will not affect their attenance or studies.

Covid-19 Testing

Testing will be avaible in the Student Clininc, located at the Commons Dormitory.

In the case of a positive test result, the infected persons will be required to quarantine at our on-site facility. Contact tracing protocols will be implemented in order to reduce the spread as much as possible.

Previously positive, but non-contagious persons are not required to test again once proper documentation has been provided.

Safety

While the University does not require that students wear masks, the University strongly encourages students to wear them at all times during gatherings of five or more to mitigate the potential spread of COVID-19.

One-use wear masks should never be re-worn, as that can lessen the effectiveness. Cloth masks should be cleaned every day or every other day, depending on your social engagement.

The University believes the safety of its members is top priority. Every building will be provided with hand sanitizer at all the doors, as well as disinfectant spray for those enetering/exiting. Buildings will be disinfected every two hours by the cleaning staff, and free masks will be provided to those who need one.

); } export default Faq;
